case_circumstances: The body of a Hispanic male was found by a hunter in mountainous terrain east of Douglas. The body was found face up in a wash (ravine). The deceased appeared to have massive head injuries. The body appeared to have been turned over prior to discovery. Deceased believed to be undocumented immigrant. The name "Guerreros" was written on several items.
case_head_hair: a few gray hairs, medium length
fingerprints: Fingerprint information is available and entered
case_clothing_on_body:
beige jacket with red lining (Big Mac brand)
long-sleeved blue shirt (Kings Sport brand, size 15-15.5)
yellow and brown striped sweater
blue denim pants
blue underwear (size 30-32)
white socks
case_other_items_with_body:
name Guerreros written on several items
small piece of Mexican newspaper found near the body that was dated 2/26/1987
soap
matches from Mexico
plastic razor
broken mirror
clove of garlic
dental: Dental information / charting is available and entered
documents: There are currently no documents available for this case.
